metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue when speaking to Wyll during exploration.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: First, we kill Ketheric Thorm. Then, I'll tell you everything you want to know.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: First, we kill Ketheric Thorm. Then, I'll tell you everything you want to know.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: Yes. But first, a question. If your home were under siege, what would you sacrifice to save it?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'd give my life if it meant keeping the residents safe.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I wouldn't give up my soul, if that's what you're getting at.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: The place could burn to cinder for all I care.

2.speaker: Wyll
2.text: I could never be so disloyal to Baldur's Gate.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: I was seventeen. Father - Ulder Ravengard - had just been named a Grand Duke, and was called away to Elturel to help settle a dispute.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Yes - my father is a Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate, and I am his only son.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: That's when the Cult of the Dragon made its move.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *The Cult of the Dragon - a fractured religion. Some believers hold that undead dragons will inherit the world.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *Others worship your goddess, the dragon Tiamat, and intend to summon her to Faerûn.*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: *The Cult of the Dragon - a fractured religion. Some believers hold that undead dragons will inherit the world.*

27.text: *The Cult of the Dragon - a fractured religion. Some believers hold that undead dragons will inherit the world.*

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *The Cult of the Dragon - a fractured religion. Some believers hold that undead dragons will inherit the world.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Others worship the dragon goddess Tiamat and intend to summon her to Faerûn.*

106.speaker: Player
106.text: What's the Cult of the Dragon? I've never heard of them.

69.speaker: Wyll
69.text: A religion devoted to conjuring the most evil of goddesses, the dragon Tiamat.

124.speaker: Wyll
124.text: A tenday after father left, I heard a whisper as I slept. 'Dusthawk Hill. The Queen of Chaos awakens. Go alone.'

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: I grabbed a rapier and set out. There wasn't a cloud in the sky, yet not a single star was shining.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: There they were, gathered at the foot of the Hill.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *Your head tingles. Wyll wants to show you what happened.*

50.text: Allow Wyll to share his memory with you.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll holds hand to head. Wyl land player mind meld. It is absolutely fine to just show the characters during the story.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Allow Wyll to share his memory with you.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll holds hand to head. Wyl land player mind meld. It is absolutely fine to just show the characters during the story.

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *In the looming shadow of the mount, five groups of five figures each encircle a lofty totem.*
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll holds hand to head. Wyl land player mind meld. It is absolutely fine to just show the characters during the story.

61.text: *Atop each totem, a dragon's head is carved, and a massive orb held in its mouth. The cultists chant, first softly, then crying to the starless sky.*
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *Atop each totem, a dragon's head is carved, and a massive orb held in its mouth. The cultists chant, first softly, then crying to the starless sky.*
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: *There is a crack of thunder, a gust of wind - and a dragon's white head appears in the storm, the first of Tiamat's five heads.*
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *There is a crack of thunder, a gust of wind - and a dragon's white head appears in the storm, the first of Tiamat's five heads.*
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *There is a crack of thunder, a gust of wind - and a dragon's white head appears in the storm, the first of Tiamat's five heads.*
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *As the maelstrom howls, Mizora's lips press to your ear. 'She will destroy Baldur's Gate. Grant me your soul - and I will give you the power to save it', she whispers.*
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll ends the mind meld at the end of the line.

128.text: *There is a crack of thunder, a gust of wind - and a dragon's white head appears in the storm.*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *There is a crack of thunder, a gust of wind - and a dragon's white head appears in the storm.*

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Use your words, Wyll, and leave my mind alone.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll removes his hand from his head, No mind meld occurs.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: I'll paint the clearest picture I can.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll removes his hand from his head, No mind meld occurs.

21.text: Below the mount I saw five totems with dragon heads carved on top. Each head held a massive orb in its jaws.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: Below the mount I saw five totems with dragon heads carved on top. Each head held a massive orb in its jaws.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Orbs of dragonkind. Could it be? I thought only three were left.

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: Orbs of dragonkind. Could it be? I thought only three were left.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Around each totem, five robed figures were chanting. First softly, then loud as a banshee's wail.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: Around each totem, five robed figures were chanting. First softly, then loud as a banshee's wail.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: There was a crack of thunder and a gust of wind. A storm descended -

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: - and one of Tiamat's five heads appeared from within it.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: That's when I felt Mizora's lips against my ear, and heard that same canny whisper.

60.speaker: Wyll
60.text: 'She will destroy Baldur's Gate. Grant me your soul - and I will give you the power to save it.'

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: She read the terms while two devils stood witness. And I said yes. One soul for one city.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Surely Mizora doesn't care about Baldur's Gate. Why would she want to save it?

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: She didn't - she came on order of her mistress Zariel.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: She never stops, does she. Not for a second.

118.speaker: Karlach
118.text: She never stops, does she. Not for a second.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Tiamat made a play for power. Zariel had other plans. That's the most Mizora's ever said - all that mattered was that she got her prize:

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Tiamat made a play for power. Zariel had other plans. That's the most Mizora's ever said - all that mattered was that she got her prize:

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: Another pet added to her warlock menagerie.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: It was brave, what you did for the city.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: A brave choice. And a frightening one.

81.speaker: Wyll
81.text: I don't know that it was brave. I just know that it was right.

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: The moment I agreed, I burned with the fires of Avernus and oozed the rot of Dis.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Sacrificing your soul to save the city was a brave thing to do.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You took on twenty-five cultists on your own? I find that hard to believe.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: I had Mizora at my side - and the archdevil Zariel guided our hands that day.

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: I burned with the fires of Avernus and oozed the rot of Dis.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: The cultists choked on our poisons and burned from our flames. When we were done, all that remained were five greyed orbs atop a pile of ash.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: My soul was bound and my lips were sealed.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Is that how you lost your eye - in the battle with the Cult of the Dragon?

71.speaker: Wyll
71.text: It is. The one scar I ever bore of it.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: You were right, of course - the new eye is a sending stone, courtesy of Mizora. She uses it to track my location and call from a distance.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: I could flee to the Spine of the World or the depths of the Lowerdark, and still never shake her.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: Mizora replaced it with a sending stone. She uses it to track my location and speak from a distance.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: And what about your father the Grand Duke?

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: He returned to an unsuspecting city and a wayward son with a smirking devil at his side.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: I tried to tell him the truth, but my mouth couldn't form the words. I led him to the battlefield, but Mizora had swept it clean.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: I showed him my stone eye - but he only turned away.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: After, he said only one word: 'Go.' So I did.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: We'll return to this subject later.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Let's finish this tale later, all right?
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll removes his hand from his head.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Another time, then. I'll hold nothing back.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll removes his hand from his head.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: The Cult of the Dragon had infiltrated Baldur's Gate? To what end?

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: To conjure the Dragon Queen and lay waste to Baldur's Gate.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The Grand Duke left a mere boy in charge? That can't have gone well.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: Not just a boy - a Ravengard, schooled in the four pillars: Courage, insight, strategy, justice.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Nod and let Wyll continue his story.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: My clan is my home. I would give up life and limb to see them safe.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: Then you know loyalty. And you know I did what had to be done.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: If Crèche K'liir were in danger, I'd rage until every last assailant was dead.

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: Fiercely loyal to your people. Then you'll understand that I did what had to be done.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: She came on orders of her mistress Zariel.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: She came on orders of her mistress Zariel.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Your tadpole shivers as your mind bonds with Wyll's. Your memories of freeing Mizora are now his, too.*

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: So Zariel's asset was none other than Mizora herself. Of course. Tricks on top of tricks on top of tricks.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: But I've got only six months before I'm made a free man, thanks be to the Triad.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: No, scratch that. Thanks be to you.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Mizora said you can talk about your pact and exile. It's time I know the whole truth.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: First, we kill Ketheric Thorm. Then I'll tell you everything you want to know.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: We're fortunate you can keep your powers until then. We're going to need them.

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: These infernal talents are useful, I admit. Once they're gone, I'll have to rely my wits and my training. They'll have to do.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: The Coast needs the Blade, and I have no intention of turning my back on it.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Six months is a long time. Time enough to weasel her way out of her promise.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: I can't imagine how. The pact binds her as tightly as it binds me.

123.speaker: Wyll
123.text: All I have to do is stay alive. That should be easy enough, with someone of your skill at my side.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: It's not too late to change your mind. There'd be no Blade without your warlock talents.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: The Blade of Frontiers is fuelled by more than Avernus' flames.

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: I have my father's training, I have cunning, I have my wits. And they'll have to do.

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: Godsdamnit, I'll never be rid of her. The more I want to shake her leash, the tighter she pulls it.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: We'll find you a way out of this pact, I'm sure of it.

126.speaker: Wyll
126.text: You're positively brimming with confidence. Mind if I borrow a handful?

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: Once you're stuck to a devil, they're hard to brush off. But you - you make me think I still have a chance.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Is being pacted all that bad? There'd be no Blade of Frontiers without your warlock talents.

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: I have my father's training, I have cunning, I have my wits. If I ever manage to break this pact, they'll more than do.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Give it up, Wyll. She owns your soul, so you better get used to it.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: What was it father said? 'Fear is what you feel, courage is what you do.'

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: I should be telling you to find your mettle. Have a little faith, push against the raging winds. That sort of thing.

58.speaker: Wyll
58.text: But I'd only tell you that if you were wrong. This is the hand I was dealt. I need to make the most of it.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: Zariel's asset was none other than Mizora herself. Of course. Tricks on top of tricks on top of tricks.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: If you remember, I'd heard a whisper in the night directing me to Dusthawk Hill. That's where I found the cultists, joined in ritual prayer.

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: If you remember, I'd heard a whisper in the night directing me to Dusthawk Hill. That's where I found the cultists, joined in ritual prayer.
